newsitem.title: USA: Ply Gem shares rise after second buyout bid. [CORRECTED 21:49 GMT]
newsitem.headline: Ply Gem shares rise after second buyout bid. [CORRECTED 21:49 GMT]

text.p: Shares of Ply Gem Industries Inc climbed to a 12-month high Tuesday after the company said it received a second buyout offer in two months.

Ply Gem, a New York-based maker of home improvement products such as replacement windows and siding, said it received a $19.50-per-share offer from an undisclosed party. That rivals an earlier agreement from Atrium Corp worth $18.75 per share.
In afternoon trade, Ply Gem shares were up 1-1/16 at 19-5/16, slipping from a year-high of 19-7/16 reached earlier in the session.
A spokesman for Ply Gem did not immediately return a telephone call seeking further details.
A spokesman for Hicks, Muse Tate and Furst -- the buyout firm that owns 80 percent of Atrium -- declined to comment. Both Atrium and Hicks Muse are privately held.
Three weeks ago, Ply Gem said it agreed to be acquired by Atrium for $482 million (corrects from $428 million), including debt assumption.
Ply Gem said its Atrium pact contained a fiduciary exit clause that would require payment of $9.5 million and up to $2.5 million in expenses to Atrium if Ply Gem opted to accept a competing bid.
According to Standard & Poor's, Ply Gem had 13.9 million shares outstanding as of March 31.
